transcript.text: [Music]
[Music]
you
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1399 a and today's date is
October 12th 2017 and the thought of the
episode is the economic downturn is
accelerating let's get into the economic
collapse financial news now we are
getting so many different mixed messages
on the crypto market from the central
bankers and we know that the central
bankers their main objective is to take
control
we know that UBS and many of the other
banks they're working together to create
a cryptocurrency the central bank is out
there saying listen it is a good idea
but we need to control the crypto market
we'll keep it stable and they're trying
to push that agenda now on the other
side there are others who probably are
losing a lot of money from the trades
where they don't like the crypto market
and they're trying to you know push
people away or drive the prices down so
they can get into the crypto market I
mean one of those individuals was Jay
CEO Jamie Dimon of JPMorgan Chase where
he lashed out at the crypto market
calling a complete fraud worse than
tulip bulbs so we see right now that
we're getting messages from all over the
place but if we fast forward to today
Jamie Dimon he won't even talk about the
crypto market and what we've been seeing
lately is the crypto market this is an
open and free market it's decentralized
as of right now and we can see that yes
Bitcoin and many of the other crypto
currencies they are volatile they move
up and down but this is what a free and
open market does it doesn't just keep
moving in one direction because if
something is just moving in one
direction most likely it's manipulated
and it's being set up to be a bubble now
there is a lot of individuals out there
that have no idea what bitcoin is they
might have heard about it they might
have heard it in passing they're not
really dealing with it so when people
say this is in a bubble it really isn't
and I do believe that as we move forward
the crypto market will play a role in
the currency market in the future now
the only question is who is going to
control it now we've been following
the economy and we see that there are
many many pieces to the economy and many
of the pieces are starting to fall apart
we see out in Canada Sears as we know
they are in a whole lot of trouble and
the whole entire retail market for them
is completely imploding and it looks
like Sears Canada they're gonna be
liquidating about a hundred and fifty
stores that's about 12,000 jobs now
Canada adds around 12,000 jobs each
month now let's think about this for a
second here there's gonna be 12,000 jobs
that will be lost that means there's
gonna be a lot of part-time full-time
people looking for work plus all those
stores all that commercial real estate
becomes available right now it's going
to be vacant and we know that Canada
adds around 12,000 people a month now
this is going to be a huge problem of
course they'll manipulate the numbers
somehow to make it look like
everything's fine they'll spread it over
time this is what the US does and a lot
of countries do copy this and they're
gonna make it look like it's a lot
better than it really is
but we can see just from this this is
not the only store we have Toys R Us we
have Gymboree we have many many other
stores that are in a huge amount of
trouble and as we move forward there's
going to be a lot more stores they're
going to be added to the bankrupt stores
now we know the automobile industry
they're in a heap of trouble
GM is going to be laying off about 1,500
more workers because right now as we
know car sales are plunging now they're
trying to do whatever they possibly can
to get people to purchase cars and this
is why they've been going to the
subprime people to the sub problem Prime
people no money down and remember when
you buy a car
you're really not using your own money
you're just borrowing this money now as
we can see they are cutting production
they're going to be laying off people a
lot of people think this is just
temporary but as we're getting word from
GM this is not going to be temporary
because what they're saying is that
sales are not that great we might be
bringing back a you know a lot fewer
people but we're going to cut produc
and we know what happens as time goes on
all of a sudden they will end up closing
the plant because they just can't make
the sales now we can see by all these
different indicators that the economy is
accelerating to the downside JPMorgan
Chase their net credit card charge offs
remained over 1 billion as of September
30th and to be precise this is the
highest level going back to March 2013
and we've seen this before
it looks like we're ticking up once
again back to well back to the 2010-2011
area where the charge offs were very
very high and this is just another sign
that we are in a heap of trouble credit
card losses in JPMorgan Chase went from
1.3 billion up to 1.5 billion so we're
in trouble here and this is just another
indicator that we have a huge amount of
problems now we talk a lot about real
estate and we talked about how how the
real estate market is not doing well and
the National Association of Realtors
pulled around 2000 Millennials between
the ages of 22 and 35 about student debt
and home ownership only 20% of those
certified surveyed owned a home of the 8
in 10 that didn't own a home 83% of them
said student debt was the reason 84%
said they have to delay a home purchases
for years because they're just not
making the money and they have too much
student loan debt now that is absolutely
awful and we could see the the housing
market is really getting hit but we know
and we talked about this before there
was a home builder called Lenore and
they announced that they would pay a big
chunk of the student loan for any borrow
buying a home that means they are
desperate at this time because they
cannot find people to purchase homes now
we need to think about something debt
has become such a keystone of our
society
the only way we can afford something is
to swap one type of debt that you can't
afford with another type of debt now
those people who are just coming out of
college or you know they have a job or
they've lost their job you know when I'm
talking about it is very difficult to go
out and purchase a home purchase a car
with cash and a lot of times when you go
to the store using credit so there was a
study by Pew Charitable Trusts show that
41% of US households have less than 2000
and savings a full one-third have zero
savings including one in ten families
with over a hundred thousand in income
another study showed that 70 percent of
Americans had less than four thousand in
savings the point is America is broke a
single surprise expense like a flat tire
or a doctor visit could wipe out most of
these individuals and people who are
continually buying homes cars TVs
college education all they're doing is
adding to their already existing debt
and they just keep on taking on more
debt they're not making any more money
they have higher payments and this is
the way the central bankers like to have
it they like you to be in debt this is
their whole entire plan this is what
they do their product is debt and they
want people to take out more debt they
don't want people to have savings they
don't want people to use cash they want
people to use debt this is where they
make their money
this is where they get their control now
there is an inflation storm coming now
we talked about this before when we look
at the US dollar the US dollar has lost
her mind eighty-four percent of its
purchasing power since 1971
and yet the Fed has claimed that
inflation has been subdued or under
control throughout that time period well
it hasn't because what we've been seeing
is as the value of the dollar decreases
that means it takes a lot more dollars
to pay for those products
and we can see right now that by looking
at what has been happening since the 70s
we can see these different indicators
that show us that inflation has been a
problem and will be a problem as we move
forward now with this level of currency
depreciation incomes would have to rise
exponentially to compensate for
Americans high cost of living and they
haven't as a result of this Americans
have an increasingly relied relied on to
parents working instead of one while
supplementing their incomes with credit
cards and other debt instruments and
this is what we've been seeing over time
and it's getting worse now people are
losing their high-paying jobs and
they're getting these part-time jobs
which makes it even worse now put simply
when we look at all this whatever
the Fed is throwing out there in regards
to inflation is pretty much garbage they
purposely want us to believe that
inflation doesn't exist because it
allows the Fed to overstate GDP growth
and paper over the fact that incomes
have been on the decline relative to
cost of living since the early 70s and
we can see right now that the economy
well its accelerating to the downside
we've been looking at all these
indicators and every day we look at
something different and we can see that
it is not improving yes they can try to
convince us that it's improving yes they
can give us manipulated numbers but when
we look at the hard facts and we start
looking at each and every one of them we
know there's a problem I mean today if I
told you and let's say we're back in
2008 and I told you the subprime
securities are completely garbage
because I looked inside of them and they
were all defaulting there's no way
they're triple-a most of the people out
there would say you're absolutely
ridiculous you have no real proof you
don't know what you're talking about the
rating agencies out there are telling us
is triple-a the government is saying
everything is fine the Fed is saying
everything is fine you don't know what
you're talking about
and guess what happened it turned out to
be absolutely true they were complete
garbage they weren't triple-a people
were defaulting and all the rating
agencies the Fed the government they
didn't care they were out there spewing
the propaganda that everything was
fantastic here we are looking at the
same exact thing we're saying the same
exactly not just that subprime
securities we're looking at the housing
market why are there problems what have
they done to convince us that housing is
doing a lot better than it really is
we're looking at the automobile industry
what have they done to make us convinced
that it's doing a lot better than it
really is remember channel stuffing
remember sales how it's all done same
thing with retail you know when a store
goes out of business and they close up
shop they don't just go and say okay all
those sales just stopped they take what
they've had and they spread it over the
rest of the year to make it seem like
it's a lot better than it really is
so we're doing the same thing and it's
very hard for people to believe this
because the corporate media because the
Fed the government is telling them
something completely different but when
things start to fall apart you'll start
to realize holy moley that was true just
like the subprime securities there were
a few individuals that knew it was true
they knew it was going to crash they
didn't know when they put a bet that it
was going to crash people yelled at then
they laughed at them saying we'll take
your money but what happened in the end
they were right the corporate media the
people in these financial institutions
the Fed the government all wrong the
same things happening right now listen
everyone thanks a lot for listening be
well be safe and especially be prepared
thanks a lot
[Music]
you
you
